ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how impactful and inspiring faculty (Rob) can be in shaping your worldviews and lifelong goals.

I gained knowledge about Mozambique, multi-donor funds, and development-work coordination.

Skills: I learned to work in a group, handle interviews, take meeting notes, work with a client, synthesize perspectives from multiple stakeholders, and draft a concise proposal to distill insights from a month-long project.

I gained insights about the pace and fragmentation of bureaucratic work, the lack of communication/coordination between agencies, and the

This is such a unique structure and style to a class. I'm incredibly grateful to have this as my senior thesis because I truly believe I learned more working with a client and in a team setting than I would have just writing a standard thesis. I learned team work, delegating work, how to interact with clients, and how to expand a network to build the stakeholder analysis we would need to compile out report.
In-depth knowledge of a niche topic (a specific development funding mechanism) and the intricacies of government, IGO, NGO, and foreign service operations.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Rob was the main strength of this capstone. We felt that we could explore the ideas more in depth both substantively and quantitatively and would suggest a year-long undertaking.

Our capstone's greatest strength was without a doubt David Robinson. He is a great capstone leader, who trusts the team to work according to their strengths, abilities, and individual capacity. He encourages learning, and honest reflection/discussion about the content matter and the work of stakeholders, and he gives students a great amount of flexibility and independence.

Weaknesses: the project was extremely vague and not super interesting, although we made the most of it and found something useful to make of it. Jackson does not seem to take the capstones very seriously. The choices were disappointing and did not include some of the most important issues in global affairs, including climate change or China. Jackson was also disorganized in response to travel requests, and the  "panel" presiding over the final presentations included only three judges, one being asynchronous and another watching remotely...

More guidance from Jackson on the guidelines of the Capstone, travel requirements/rules, and deadlines would have been appreciated if given up front.

Everything else is a strength; I had a wonderful time and learned a lot. It was truly an exercise in critical thinking having to start from nothing to produce a final deliverable with minimal oversight/management from an instructor.

Strengths; ROB!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We undoubtedly had the best Capstone advisor of any of the groups. He was extremely helpful and insightful, and it was such a highlight to get to work with and learn from him over the course of the semester; we would always leave the classroom gushing about how much we adored him. Unfortunately, despite Rob's performance as our advisor (incredible, showstopping, spectacular), the lack of organization on behalf of Jackson administration was extremely disappointing and made it much more challenging for us to enjoy our project or stay sane. More information should be conveyed to students at the onset of the course, more frequent communication with advisors should occur, and the School should heavily consider having capstones be a year-long commitment, or at the very least have them start a bit earlier in the Spring so work can be done over the Summer.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Would only recommend if Rob is your advisor.
I would not recommend the capstone itself as an academic experience, but I would definitely recommend David Robinson as a capstone leader.
